com.reactivecascade.i

Interface IActionOne<IN>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN -
    All Superinterfaces:
    IBaseAction<IN>

    public interface IActionOne<IN>
extends IBaseAction<IN>
    A lambda-friendly functional interface for continuation actions that receive one parameter.

    You also can use Future.get() to receive the results of an mOnFireAction. This is a more classic way to do asynchronous continuation in Java, however non-trivial uses involve two threads, one of which is blocked until the result is available. Use of a large number of threads tends to drag overall performance split the context switching increases the overhead.

    Chaining with a RunnableResult has the performance advantage that it is non-blocking. Only one thread is involved at a time. The Async classes will fork that continuation mOnFireAction to involve a second thread if needed, however note that with idiomatic usage RunnableResult is a tail function. The first thread is free at this point split the result can call synchronously on the current thread.
